Title: Equinor and SEFE ink 10-year gas supply deal
Description: Norway’s state-owned energy company Equinor will supply Germany’s Securing Energy for Europe (SEFE) with 111 TWh, or around 10 billion m3 per year, of natural gas for a period of 10 years with the option of a five-year extension. The deal is based on market price and the deliveries will be to Germany’s Trading Hub Europe (THE), Dutch Title Transfer Facility (TTF) and the UK’s National Balancing Point (NBP).
Author: JS

Title: BP, Equinor halt shipments through Red Sea as other LNG ship charterers reassess situation
Description: BP and Equinor have decided to suspend their shipments through the Red Sea, while other LNG ship charterers are reassessing the risks of sending their ships through the area amid continuing attacks on commercial ships by Yemen’s Houthi rebels that have heightened safety risks and pose a threat to trade flows through this vital waterway linking Europe and Asia.
Author: CK
